ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: When a vapour condenses on a horizontal or vertical surface, the bulk temperature of the condensate is always
ENGLISH.OPT1: Equal to the saturation temperature at the vapour pressure.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A furnace is made of fire brick having thickness m and k = 0.8 W/mK. For the same heat loss (W/m2) and temperature drop, another material having k = 0.16 W/mK will have its thickness
A solar flux of 1400 W/m2 directly strikes a space-vehicle surface, which has a solar absorptivity of 0.4 and thermal emissivity of 0.6. The equilibrium temperature of this surface in space at 0 K is

Consider steady one-dimensional heat flow in a plate of 20 mm thickness, with a uniform heat generation of 80 MW/m3. The left and right faces are kept at constant temperature of 160°C and 120°C respectively. The plate has thermal conductivity of 200 W/mK. The location of maximum temperature with in the plate from its right face is (in mm) ________. [Rounded off to nearest integer]

Choose the incorrect statement(s):
For a given value of Nusselt number, the convective heat transfer coefficient h
ENGLISH.OPT1: Decreases with increasing thermal conductivity of the fluid.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Increases with distance X from the leading edge.
ENGLISH.OPT3: Increases with the thermal conductivity of fluid.
ENGLISH.OPT4: Is independent of the distance

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: Steel ball bearing (k = 50 W/mK, α = 1.3 × 10–5 m2/s) having diameter of 40 mm are heated to a temperature of 650°C and then quenched in a tank at 55°C. The heat transfer coefficient between the ball bearing and oil is 300 W/m2 K. The total amount of heat removed (in KJ) from each bearing during the time it reaches to a temperature of 200°C is ________. [Rounded off to 1 decimal place]

A solid sphere of radius 0.5 m has an internal heat generation rate of 2 × 106 W/m3. If the thermal conductivity of the material is 40 W/mK and the convective heat transfer coefficient at the surface of the sphere is 10 kW/m2 K. What is the temperature at the centre of the sphere? Take the ambient temperature as 30°C.

Engine oil at 60°C flows over the upper surface of a 5 m long flat plate whose temperature is 20°C with velocity of 2 m/s. The rate of heat transfer per unit width of the entire place is (in W/m) ________. [Rounded off to the nearest integer]
Data: ρ = 876 kg/m3, Pr = 2962, k = 0.1444 W/mK, = 2.485 × 10–4 m2/s
If M represents the molecular weight and T represents the temperature of a gas, the thermal conductivity of the gas will increase when
Which of the following is/are correct?
ENGLISH.OPT1: If a condensing liquid wets a surface, dropwise condensation takes place.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Dropwise condensation has a higher heat transfer coefficient than filmwise condensation.
ENGLISH.OPT3: Suitable coating is used to promote filmwise condensation.
ENGLISH.OPT4: Reynold’s number of condensing liquid is calculated on its mass flow rate.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
Heat is generated in a long 0.3 cm diameter cylindrical electric heater at a rate of 180 W/cm3. The heat flux at the surface of the heater in steady operation is

(in W/cm2) ________. [Rounded off to 1 decimal place]

An evaporator is used to concentrate 4536 kg/hr of a 20% solution of NaOH in water entering at 60°C to a product of 50% solid. The pressure of the saturated steam used is 172.4 kPa and the pressure in the vapour space of the evaporator is 11.7 kPa. The overall heat transfer coefficient is 1560 W/m2 K. The value of steam economy is ________. [Rounded off to 3rd decimal places]

In a 25 mm diameter tube, the pressure drop per meter length is 0.0002 bar at a section where the mean velocity is 24 m/s and the mean specific heat of the gas is 1.13 kJ/kg K. The value of heat transfer coefficient by using Reynold’s analogy is

A 3 cm long, 2 mm × 2 mm rectangular cross-section aluminium fin (K = 237 W/m.K) is attached to a surface. If the fin efficiency is 65 percent, the effectiveness of this single fin is ________ (rounded off to the nearest integer).
The convective heat transfer coefficient for laminar and turbulent flows over a flat plate varies respectively as
Match List-I with List-II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

A thermocouple initially at 25°C, when placed in a gas stream at 200°C measures a temperature of 198°C in 5 seconds. The junction diameter of the thermocouple is
Data: ρ = 8940 kg/m3, Cp = 384 J/kg K, k = 390 W/mK, h = 400 W/m2 K

A fluid (Prandtl number, Pr = 1) at 500 K flows over a flat plate of 1.5 m length, maintained at 300 K. The velocity of the fluid is 10 m/s. Assuming kinematic viscosity ν = 30 × 10–6 m2/s, the thermal boundary layer thickness at 0.5 m from the leading edge is (in mm) ________. [Rounded off to 1 decimal place]
Which of the following is/are correct regarding boiling heat transfer?
ENGLISH.OPT1: The peak of the boiling curve indicates the critical heat flux and the burnout point.
ENGLISH.OPT2: This point also indicates the onset of departure from nucleate boiling.
ENGLISH.OPT3: It is desired to operate the heat transfer surface close to this value, but it is dangerous to exceed it.
ENGLISH.OPT4: Nucleate boiling is followed by film boiling when heat transfer is maximum.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: For a given statements in a fully developed laminar flow through a tube, select the incorrect one.
ENGLISH.OPT3: The temperature profile T(r) continuously changes with X.
ENGLISH.OPT4: For constant tube wall temperature, surface heat flux is constant.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A 5 m diameter spherical tank is filled with liquid oxygen (ρ = 1141 kg/m3, Cp = 1.71 kJ/kg °C) at –184°C. It is observed that the temperature of oxygen increases to –183°C in a 144 hour period. The average rate of heat transfer to the tank is (in watt) ________. [Rounded off to the nearest integer]

The temperature at the inner and outer surface of a 15 cm thick plane wall are measured to be 40°C and 28°C respectively. The expression for steady, one-dimensional variation of temperature in the wall is

Water at 20°C flowing at the rate of 0.015 kg/s enters a 25 mm ID tube which is maintained at a temperature of 90°C. Assuming hydrodynamically and thermally fully developed flow, the tube length required to heat the water to 70°C is (in m) ________ (rounded of to 2 decimal places).
Data: ρ = 992 kg/m3, Cp = 4180 J/kg K, k = 0.638 W/mK, = 0.613 × 10–6 m2/s, Nud = 3.657

Two very large parallel plates are maintained at uniform temperature T1 = 750 K and T2 = 500 K and have emissivities ∈1 = 0.85 and ∈2 = 0.7 respectively. If a thin aluminium sheet with the same emissivity on both sides is to be placed between the plates in order to reduce the net rate of radiation heat transfer between the plates by 90%, the emissivity of the aluminium sheet must be

A 100 W electric bulb was switched on in a 2.5 m × 3 m × 3 m size thermally insulated room having a temperature of 20°C. The room temperature at the end of 24 hours will be (in °C) ________. [Rounded off to the nearest integer]
Take: ρair = 1.2 kg/m3, CV = 0.717 KJ/kg K, CP = 1.005 KJ/kg.K, R = 0.288 KJ/kg K

A copper fin (k = 396 W/mK) 0.25 cm in diameter protrudes from a wall at 95°C into ambient air at 25°C. The heat transfer coefficient by free convection is equal to 10 W/m2 K. Calculate the heat loss, if the fin is infinitely long.
Consider a system of concentric spheres of radius r1 and r2 (r2 > r1). If r1 = 5 cm, what is value of the radius r2 if it is desired to have the value of shape factor F21 equal to 0.6?

Consider a gray and opaque surface at 0ºC in an environment at 25ºC. The surface has an emissivity of 0.8. If the radiation incident on the surface is 240 W/m2, the radiosity of the surface is ________ (in W/m2). [Rounded off to the nearest integer]
Which of the statement(s) is/are incorrect?
ENGLISH.OPT1: Gray surface for which the special absorptivity and the emissivity are independent of wavelength over the spectral regions of surface irradiation and emission.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Emissivity is the rate of radiant energy emitted by a surface in all directions per unit area of the surface.
ENGLISH.OPT3: Intensity is the rate of radiant energy propagation in a particular direction per unit area normal to the direction per unit solid angle about the direction.
ENGLISH.OPT4: Irradiation is the rate at which radiation leaves a surface due to emission and reflection in all directions per unit area of the surface.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
A flow of 0.1 kg/s of exhaust gases at 700 K from a gas turbine is used to pre heat the incoming air with the same mass flow rate, which is at the ambient temperature of 300 K. It is desired to cool the exhaust to 400 K and it is estimated that an overall heat transfer coefficient of 30 W/m2 K can be achieved in an appropriate exchanger. Take the specific heat of exhaust gases the same as for air, which is 1000 J/kg K. The area required for counter flow heat exchanger is

(in m2) ________. [Rounded off to nearest integer]
The biot number can be thought of as the ratio of
ENGLISH.OPT1: The conduction thermal resistance to the convective thermal resistance.
ENGLISH.OPT2: The convective thermal resistance to the conduction thermal resistance.
ENGLISH.OPT3: The thermal energy storage capacity to the conduction thermal resistance.
ENGLISH.OPT4: The thermal energy storage capacity to the convection thermal resistance.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
Cold water (Cp = 4.18 kJ/kg K) enters a counter-flow heat exchanger at 18°C at a rate of 0.7 kg/s where it is heated by hot air (Cp = 1.0 kJ/kg K) that enters the heat exchanger at 50°C at the rate of 1.6 kg/s and leaves at 25°C. The maximum possible outlet temperature of the cold water is (in °C) ________.

[Rounded off to 1 decimal place]

A counter flow shell and tube heat exchanger is used to heat water with hot exhaust gases. The water [C = 4180 J/kg K] flows at the rate of 2 kg/s and the exhaust gases [C = 1000 J/kg K] flow at the rate of 5 kg/s. If the heat transfer surface area is 32 m2 and the overall heat transfer coefficient is 200 W/m2 K. The NTU of the heat exchanger is

TEST_NAME: Subjectwise Test-2 Part Syllabus GATE 2025 CH Heat Transfer
